actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:00 a.m. on December 6, 2024.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Roy moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House received a communication from Representative Kim (NJ) wherein he resigns as a member of the House of Representatives effective on December 8, 2024.

Mr. Burlison asked unanimous consent that he may hereafter be considered as the first sponsor of H.R. 374, a bill originally introduced by Representative Gaetz, for the purpose of adding cosponsors and requesting reprintings pursuant to clause 7 of rule XII. Agreed to without objection.
Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.

actions-list.header: On motion to refer Agreed to by recorded vote: 204

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to refer was ordered without objection.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to refer H. Res. 1609.
Mr. Scalise moved to refer to Ethics.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1609 — "Directing the Committee on Ethics to preserve and release records of the Committee's review of the alleged misconduct of Matthew Louis Gaetz II of Florida while serving as a Member of the House of Representatives."
Without objection, the motion to reconsider is laid upon the table.

actions-list.header: On motion to refer Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 206

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to refer was ordered without objection.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on the motion to refer H. Res. 1608.
Mr. Scalise moved to refer to Ethics.

Considered as privileged matter. H. Res. 1608 — "Directing the Committee on Ethics of the House of Representatives to release to the public the committee's report on its investigation into allegations against former Representative Matt Gaetz."

actions-list.header: QUESTION OF THE PRIVILEGES OF THE HOUSE
actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Casten rose to a question of the privileges of the House and offered the resolution. The Chair directed the Clerk to report the resolution. Upon examination of the resolution, the Chair determined that the resolution did constitute a question of the privileges of the House.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 208
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 197

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Mr. Landsman moved to recommit to the Committee on the Judiciary.

actions-list.header: On agreeing to the Velazquez amendment; Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 199

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 7198 — "To amend title 5, United States Code, to require greater transparency for Federal regulatory decisions that impact small businesses, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 381
actions-list.actionItem: 15, 2 Present (Roll no. 486).

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9600 — "To designate the facility of the United States Postal Service located at 119 Main Street in Plains, Georgia, as the "Jimmy and Rosalynn Carter Post Office"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 399
actions-list.actionItem: 1 (Roll no. 485).
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 9598 — "To amend the Office of National Drug Control Policy Reauthorization Act to reauthorize such Office, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 389
actions-list.actionItem: 6 (Roll no. 484).
Considered as unfinished business. S. 709 — "To improve performance and accountability in the Federal Government, and for other purposes."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 8413.
Considered under suspension of the rules.

Mr. Westerman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended. H.R. 8413 — "To provide for the conveyance of certain Federal land at Swanson Reservoir and Hugh Butler Reservoir in the State of Nebraska, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.

At the conclusion of debate on the Velazquez amendment No. 1, the Chair put the question on agreeing to the amendment and by voice vote, announced the noes had prevailed. Ms. Velazquez demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered on the amendment and the bill pursuant to the rule.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1602, the House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the Velazquez amendment No.1.

An amendment, offered by Ms. Velazquez,  numbered 1 printed in Part B of House Report 118-791 to require the Office of Advocacy to train rule-writing staff at agencies on the requirements of the Regulatory Flexibility Act at least once every four years.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 7198.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 5349 and H.R. 7198. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 5349 and H.R. 7198 under a structured rule. Rule provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on each bill.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 1602. H.R. 7198 — "To amend title 5, United States Code, to require greater transparency for Federal regulatory decisions that impact small businesses, and for other purposes."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Plaskett to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of December 5.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House resumed with Morning-Hour Debate.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 712, S. 3242, S. 3738, S. 4477, H.R. 1432, H.R. 3821, and H.R. 5863.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Daniel Meuser to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
